register.description: Clock control register.

bitfield.description: Force all the transactions to go to one AXI
Determines which HI/MC to use while reading registers
Isolate GPU bit
VG pipe is idle
2D pipe is idle
3D pipe is idle
Soft resets the subsystem
Disable debug registers. If this bit is 1, debug registers are clock gated
Disables clock gating for RAMs
Disable 2D clock
Disable 3D clock

register.description: Idle status register.

bitfield.description: AXI is in low power mode
Unused bits reserved for future expansion
TS is idle
FP is idle
IM is idle
VG is idle
TX is idle
RA is idle
SE is idle
PA is idle
SH is idle
PE is idle
DE is idle
FE is idle

register.description: AXI config
AXI status
Interrupt acknowledge register. Each bit represents a corresponding event being triggered. Reading from this register clears the outstanding interrupt.
Interrupt enable register. Each bit enables a corresponding event.
Identification register.

bitfield.description: Family value 0x1: GC500 0x2: GC520 0x3: GC530 0x4: GC400 0x5: GC450 0x8: GC600 0x9: GC700 0xA: GC350 0xB: GC380 0xC: GC800 0x10: GC1000 0x14: GC2000
Product value
Revision value
Technology value
Customer value

register.description: Shows which features are enabled in current subsystem implementation. 0 : NONE 1 : AVAILABLE

bitfield.description: Supports 20 bit index.
Supports resolveing into YUV target.
3D PE has byte write capability.
FE 2.0 is present.
VG tesselator is present.
VG pipe is present.
32 bit memory address support.
YUY2 support in PE and YUY2 to RGB conversion in resolve.
TX cache is half.
PE cache is half.
YUY2 averaging support in resolve.
No 2D scaler.
Supports byte write in 2D.
Supports interleaving depth and color buffers.
No 422 texture input format.
No early-Z.
Configured to have minimum area.
Second level clock gating is available.
YUV 4:2:0 tiler is available.
Shows if there is HDR support.
Shows if there is HD scaler.
ETC1 texture compression.
Shows if there is 2D engine.
Shows if there is a display controller.
MSAA support.
YUV 4:2:0 support in filter blit.
Depth and color compression.
Debug registers.
DXT texture compression.
3D pipe.
Full-screen anti-aliasing.
Fast clear.

register.description: Shows the ID for the subsystem in BCD.

bitfield.description: Subsystem ID in BCD

register.description: Shows the revision for the subsystem in BCD.

bitfield.description: Revision in BCD

register.description: Shows the release date for the subsystem.

bitfield.description: Release date

register.description: Shows the release time for the subsystem.

bitfield.description: Release time

register.description: Shows the customer and group for the subsystem.
Shows which minor features are enabled in the subsytem. 0 : NONE 1 : AVAILABLE

bitfield.description: Enhance VR and add a mode to walk 16 pixels in 16-bit mode in vertical pass to improve cache hit rate when rotating 90/270.
Correct stencil behavior in depth only.
2D engine supports A8 target.
New texture unit is available.
Hierarchiccal Z is supported.
Shader supports bypass mode when MSAA is enabled.
VAA is available or not.
Put the MSAA data into sideband fifo.
New style MC with separate paths for color and depth.
Unavailable registers will return 0.
Sqrt, sin, cos instructions are available.
W is sent to SH from RA.
Minor updates to VG pipe (Event generation from VG, TS, PE). Tiled image support.
VG filter is available.
Floor, ceil, and sign instructions are available.
If this bit is not set, the FIFO counter should be set to 50. Else, the default should remain.
New commands added to the tessellator.
Major updates to VG pipe (TS buffer tiling. State masking.).
32 × 32 super tile is available.
Use 2 separate tile status buffers in interleaved mode.
2 bits are used instead of 4 bits for tile status.
Supports 8K render target.
2D PE 2.0 is present.
Proper flush is done in fast clear cache.
Special LOD calculation when MSAA is on.
Driver hack is not needed.
Supports 8K × 8K textures.
Configurable endianness support.
Dual Return Bus from HI to clients.
Y flipping capability is added to resolve.

register.description: Writing 1 will reset the counters and stop counting. Write 0 to start counting again.

bitfield.description: 1: reset the counters and stop counting 0: start counting

register.description: General purpose output register.

bitfield.description: 1 : Low power mode

register.description: Special handling on AXI Bus

bitfield.description: 0: NO_BURST_RESET_VALUE 1: BURST_RESET_VALUE

register.description: Shows which features are enabled in the subsystem. 0 : NONE 1 : AVAILABLE

bitfield.description: Dither and filter+alpha available.
EEZ and HZ are correct.
Texture has stride and memory addressing.
Double buffering support for VG (second TS--&gt;VG semaphore is present).
V2 compression.
Resolve UV swizzle.

register.description: Total cycles. This register is a free running counter. It can be reset by writing 0 to it.

bitfield.description: Total cycles

register.description: Total cycles where the GPU is idle. It is reset when register is written to. It looks at all the blocks but FE when determining the subsystem is idle.

bitfield.description: Total cycles where the GPU is idle

register.description: Specs for the subsystem
Shows which features are enabled in the subsystem 0 : NONE 1 : AVAILABLE
Control register for module level power controls.

bitfield.description: Counter value for clock gating the module if the module is idle for this amount of clock cycles
Number of clock cycles to wait after turning on the clock
Disables module level clock gating for starve/idle condition
Disables module level clock gating for stall condition
Enables module level clock gating

register.description: Module level control registers.

bitfield.description: Disables module level clock gating for starve/idle condition
Disables module level clock gating for stall condition
Enables module level clock gating
Counter value for clock gating the module if the module is idle for this amount of clock cycles
Number of clock cycles to wait after turning on the clock
Disables module level clock gating for starve/idle condition
Disables module level clock gating for stall condition
Enables module level clock gating

register.description: Module level control status

bitfield.description: Module level clock gating is ON for TX
Module level clock gating is ON for RA
Module level clock gating is ON for SE
Module level clock gating is ON for PA
Module level clock gating is ON for SH
Module level clock gating is ON for PE
Module level clock gating is ON for DE
Module level clock gating is ON for FE

register.description: Status register that holds which MMU generated an exception

bitfield.description: NOT USED
MMU 3 caused an exception and theGCREGMMUEXCEPTION3 register holds the offending address. 0x1: SLAVE_NOT_PRESENT 0x2: PAGE_NOT_PRESENT 0x3: WRITE_VIOLATION
NOT USED
MMU 2 caused an exception and theGCREGMMUEXCEPTION2 register holds the offending address. 0x1: SLAVE_NOT_PRESENT 0x2: PAGE_NOT_PRESENT 0x3: WRITE_VIOLATION
NOT USED
MMU 1 caused an exception and theGCREGMMUEXCEPTION1 register holds the offending address. 0x1: SLAVE_NOT_PRESENT 0x2: PAGE_NOT_PRESENT 0x3: WRITE_VIOLATION
NOT USED
MMU 0 caused an exception and theGCREGMMUEXCEPTION0 holds the offending address: 0x1: SLAVE_NOT_PRESENT 0x2: PAGE_NOT_PRESENT 0x3: WRITE_VIOLATION

register.description: Control register that enables the MMU (one time shot).

bitfield.description: NOT USED
Enable the MMU. For security reasons, once the MMU is enabled it cannot be disabled until reset.

register.description: Holds the original address that generated an exception

bitfield.description: The original address that generated an exception

Limit control 0: REQUESTS 1: DATA
Limits the total number of outstanding read requests.
Light sleep
Deep sleep
Powerdown memory
WTC for fast RAMs
RTC for fast RAMs

register.description: Controls the priority of the display controller requests. This works like a PWM. One register gives the period, and the other gives the ON time. When PWM is ON, display requests are accepted if both display and the other request is valid. If it is OFF, the other request will be accepted. If only one request is valid, it takes the bus regardless of the PWM bit.

bitfield.description: 'Duty cycle'

register.description: Increments every cycle.

bitfield.description: Increments every cycle

register.description: Number of outstanding reads per client in multiples of 8 bytes.

bitfield.description: Number of outstanding MMU reads in multiples of 8 bytes
Number of outstanding FE reads in multiples of 8 bytes
Number of outstanding PEZ reads in multiples of 8 bytes
Number of outstanding PEC reads in multiples of 8 bytes

register.description: Number of outstanding reads per client in multiples of 8 bytes.

bitfield.description: This field keeps the value of total read requests or total requested data (in 64 bits) depending on the value ofAQMEMORYDEBUG[19] LIMIT_CONTROL register field.
Number of outstanding FC reads in multiples of 8 bytes
Number of outstanding TX reads in multiples of 8 bytes
Number of outstanding RA reads in multiples of 8 bytes

register.description: Number of outstanding writes per client.

bitfield.description: This field keeps the value of total write requests or total requested data (in 64 bits) depending on the value ofAQMEMORYDEBUG[19] LIMIT_CONTROL register field.
Number of outstanding FC writes in multiples of 8 bytes
Number of outstanding PEZ writes in multiples of 8 bytes
Number of outstanding PEC writes in multiples of 8 bytes

register.description: 32 bit debug signal from RA.

bitfield.description: Signals according toGCDEBUGCONTROL1[19:16] RA: 0x0: Valid pixel count. 0x1: Total quad count (after EEZ). 0x2: Valid quad count (after EZ and EEZ). 0x3: Total primitive count. 0x4: Various signals from input stage. See GC320 spec for details. 0x5: Various signals from input stage. See GC320 spec for details. 0x6: Various signals from render pipe. See GC320 spec for details. 0x7: Various signals from render cache. See GC320 spec for details. 0x8: Various signals from raster engine. See GC320 spec for details. 0x9: Cache miss count (in the pipeline). 0xA: Cache miss count (in the prefetcher). 0xB: EEZ culled quads. 0xF: Signature = 0x12344321.

register.description: 32 bit debug signal from TX.

bitfield.description: Signals according toGCDEBUGCONTROL1[27:24] TX : 0x0: Total bilinear texture requests. 0x1: Total trilinear texture requests. 0x2: Total discarded texture requests. 0x3: Total texture requests. 0x4: Various signals from input stage. See GC320 spec for details. 0x5: Memory read count. 0x6: Memory read count in 8B. 0x7: Cache miss count (in the pipeline). 0x8: Total hitting texels (in pre-fetcher). 0x9: Total missing texels (in pre-fetcher). 0xF: Signature = 0x12211221.

register.description: 32 bit debug signal from FE.
32 bit debug signal from PE.

bitfield.description: Signals according toGCDEBUGCONTROL0[19:16] PE: 0x0: pixel count killed by color pipe 0x1: pixel count killed by depth pipe 0x2: pixel count drawn by color pipe 0x3: pixel count drawn by depth pipe 0x4: debug signals for 3d_io, 2d_filter, 2d_fsm 0x5: debug signals for cache2d_cntrl 0x6: debug signals for cache2d_tag_alloc 0x7: debug signals for cache3d_c_cntrl, cache3d_c_tag_alloc 0x8: debug signals for cache3d_z_cntrl, cache3d_z_tag_alloc 0x9: debug signals for pref_2d, pref_3d 0xA : debug signals for cmd_state 0xB: 2d pixel count drawn by 2d pipe 0xF: Signature = 0xBABEF00D.

register.description: 32 bit debug signal from DE.
32 bit debug signal from SH.

bitfield.description: Signals according toGCDEBUGCONTROL0[27:24] SH. Please refer to GC320 spec for bit position information for all the signals 0x0 : interface signals for debug 0x1 : Instruction Sequencing and vertex input state machine 0x2 : vertex input/output buffer full/empty. Context PC. Physical page valid 0x3 : vertex/pixel, output attribute counts. Some interface signals 0x4 : Shader cycle count, for determining the shader clock 0x5 : Current pixel XY value 0x6 : Last pixels XY value 0x7 : Total pixel instructions executed 0x8 : Total pixels shaded 0x9 : Total vertex instructions executed 0xA : Total vertices shaded 0xB : Total vertex branch instructions 0xC : Total vertex texture instructions 0xD : Total pixel branch instructions 0xE : Total pixel texture instructions 0xF : Reserved signature 0xDEADBEEF

register.description: 32 bit debug signal from PA.

bitfield.description: Signals according toGCDEBUGCONTROL1[3:0] PA: 0x0: Various signals from input stage. See GC320 spec for details. 0x1: Various signals from input stage. See GC320 spec for details. 0x2: Various signals from input stage. See GC320 spec for details. 0x3: total vertex count 0x4: input primitive count 0x5: output primitive count 0x6: depth clipped primitive count 0x7: trivial rejected primitive count 0x8: culled primitive count 0xF: Signature = 0x0000AAAA

register.description: 32 bit debug signal from SE.

bitfield.description: Signals according toGCDEBUGCONTROL1[11:8] SE: 0x0: culled triangles count. 0x1: culled lines count. 0x2: [31:18] goto signals, [17:8] main state machine state, [7:0] output state machine state. See GC320 spec for details. 0x3: [31:22] unused, [21] early_isTriangle, [20] isTriangle, [19] increment_pc_e0, [18:14] jump_to_signals. See GC320 spec for details. [13:12] max_x_p_e2, [11:10] mid_x_p_e2, [9:8] min_x_p_e2, [7:6] max_y_p_e2, [5:4] mid_y_p_e2. See GC320 spec for details. [3:2] min_y_p_e2, [1:0] min_z_p_e2. See GC320 spec for details. 0x4: area_e2. See GC320 spec for details. 0x5: x0_e2. See GC320 spec for details. 0x6: x1_e2. See GC320 spec for details. 0x7: x2_e2. See GC320 spec for details. 0x8: y0_e2. See GC320 spec for details. 0x9: y1_e2. See GC320 spec for details. 0xA: y2_e2. See GC320 spec for details. 0xB: init_y_e2. See GC320 spec for details. 0xC: init_y_e2. See GC320 spec for details. 0xD: y2_e2. See GC320 spec for details. 0xE: y2_e2. See GC320 spec for details. 0xF: Signature = 0x5E5E5E5E.

register.description: 32 bit debug signal from MC.

bitfield.description: Signals according toGCDEBUGCONTROL2[3:0] MC: 0x0: Various signals from FC block. See GC320 spec for details. 0x1: Total read req in terms of 8B from pipeline. 0x2: Total read req in terms of 8B sent out from the subsystem. 0x3: Total write req in terms of 8B from pipeline. 0xF: Signature = 0x12345678.

register.description: 32 bit debug signal from HI.

bitfield.description: Signals according toGCDEBUGCONTROL2[11:8] HI: 0x0: Number of cycles AXI read request is stalled. 0x1: Number of cycles AXI write request is stalled. 0x2: Number of cycles AXI write data is stalled. 0xF: Signature = 0xAAAAAAAA
Selects which set of 32 bit data to get from SH. Resets the counters if set to 0xF
Selects which set of 32 bit data to get from PE. Resets the counters if set to 0xF
Selects which set of 32 bit data to get from DE. Resets the counters if set to 0xF
Selects which set of 32 bit data to get from FE. Resets the counters if set to 0xF
Selects which set of 32 bit data to get from TX. Resets the counters if set to 0xF
Selects which set of 32 bit data to get from RA. Resets the counters if set to 0xF
Selects which set of 32 bit data to get from SE. Resets the counters if set to 0xF
Selects which set of 32 bit data to get from PA. Resets the counters if set to 0xF
Selects which set of 32 bit data to get from HI. Resets the counters if set to 0xF
Selects which set of 32 bit data to get from MC. Resets the counters if set to 0xF
Selects which module's output will be put in the MSB 32 bits of 64 bit debug signal. 0x0: FE 0x1: DE 0x2: PE 0x3: SH 0x4: PA 0x5: SE 0x6: RA 0x7: TX 0x8: MC
Selects which module's output will be put in the LSB 32 bits of 64 bit debug signal. 0x0: FE 0x1: DE 0x2: PE 0x3: SH 0x4: PA 0x5: SE 0x6: RA 0x7: TX 0x8: MC

register.description: Shows which features are enabled in the subsystem. 0 : NONE 1 : AVAILABLE

bitfield.description: Select the return bus for FCC
Select the return bus for TX
Select the return bus for FC-Depth
Select the return bus for MMU
Select the return bus for FE
Select the return bus for PEZ
Select the return bus for PEC
Flip the words of 32 bit data. 0x12345678 becomes 0x56781234
Flip the bytes of 16 bit data. 0x12345678 becomes 0x34127856
Flip the bits of 8 bit data. 0x12345678 becomes 0x84C2A6E1
32-bit timestamp when PE received draw_primitive_start command
32-bit timestamp when PE received draw_primitive_end command

register.description: Composition trigger.

Base address for the command buffer. The address must be 64-bit aligned and it is always physical. To use addresses above 0x8000_0000, program AQMemoryFE with the appropriate offset. Also, this register cannot be read. To check the value of the current fetch address use.

bitfield.description: 0: SYSTEM 1: VIRTUAL_SYSTEM

register.description: Command buffer control

bitfield.description: Endian control 0: NO_SWAP 1: SWAP_WORD 2: SWAP_DWORD
Command buffer 0: DISABLE 1: ENABLE
Number of 64-bit words to fetch from the command buffer.

register.description: FE status

bitfield.description: Status of the command parser. 0: Idle 1: Busy

register.description: This is the command decoder address. The address is always physical so the MSB should always be 0.
